official_title: Pilot Study of Neoadjuvant/Adjuvant Cemiplimab for High Risk Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma
brief_title: Cemiplimab Before and After Surgery for the Treatment of High Risk Cutaneous Squamous Cell Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study of cemiplimab given before and after surgery for patients with high-risk, resectable cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC), including metastatic or recurrent disease.
prior_treatments_excluded: Prior organ allograft or allogeneic bone marrow transplantation
key_inclusion_summary: Diagnosis of high-risk cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) based on specific criteria (e.g., nodal disease with ECE, in-transit metastases, T4 lesion, perineural invasion, or specific recurrent features).
Cancer confirmed to be surgically resectable.
No prior systemic immunotherapy or anti-PD1 therapy.
key_exclusion_summary: Not a surgical candidate due to medical co-morbidities or extent of disease.
Treatment with chronic immunosuppressants or prior organ/bone marrow transplant.
Active or history of immune-mediated conditions like pneumonitis, colitis, hepatitis, etc.
Requires systemic treatment with corticosteroids (> 10 mg daily prednisone equivalent).
Women who are pregnant or lactating.
